term: What leads up to re-export trade?
content:
the problem starts when the british clearly is attacking french shipping
the french has a significant interest in the caribbean, specifically, their sugar islands
the british were targeting french ships coming out of the caribbean
who was able to step up and take over the trade on behalf of the french? the americans; they arenâ€™t getting targeted
the british begin to realize that there is no point in cutting off france when americans are just doing the trading for them
the british then say that according to french mercantilist law, french colonial goods had to be carried in french ships
ironic since the british are at war with the french and are enforcing french law on the americans on behalf of the french
	what did you sayyyy
